sentence.Network_en: You'll lose your girlish figure if you don't watch out.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果不多加注意，你就会失去女孩般的苗条身段。

sentence.Network_en: Her eyes were alight with a girlish enjoyment of life.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的眼睛闪闪发亮，闪烁着少女般的幸福和满足。

sentence.Network_en: Her voice was girlish and eager.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的声音像个小姑娘似的，而且带着一股急不可耐。

list.abs: girlish games , behaviour , laughter ., 女孩子的游戏 , 举止 , 笑声.
girlish charm ; a dress too schoolgirlish for office wear .少女的魅力；太过学生化的职业装。
She engages everyone with her pretty girlish ways ., 她以漂亮的少女风度迷住了大家.
she was filled to the brim with girlish glee ., 她充满了少女的喜悦.

entry.def: If you describe a woman as girlish, you mean she behaves, looks, or sounds like a young girl, for example because she is shy, excited, or lively.

example.ex: She gave a little girlish giggle.
example.tran: 她像个小女孩一样咯咯地笑了笑。

means.word_mean: 1. befitting or characteristic of a young girl;

sentences.sentence: "a dress too schoolgirlish for office wear"

auth_sentence.content: Looking more girlish than her twenty years.
auth_sentence.res_content: Looking more girlish than her twenty years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Looking more girlish than her twenty years.

auth_sentence.content: My daughter was never girlish in any sense of the word.

auth_sentence.content: Her girlish shyness...made the colour come and go in rapid vicissitude upon her cheek.
